issues.description: ExcellenceLand declares a private attribute rides of type List<Ride> in the problem statement (and template imports List), but the solution's getter getRides() returns a Set<Ride>. This makes the getter's return type inconsistent with the attribute type required by the specification and will confuse or block students when they implement the getter to match the declared List<Ride> attribute (and when tests expect a List).
issues.suggested_fix: Make the getter's return type consistent with the declared attribute type. Change getRides() to return List<Ride> (e.g. public List<Ride> getRides()) and return a suitable List copy or an unmodifiableList (for example: return new ArrayList<>(rides); or return Collections.unmodifiableList(rides);). This preserves encapsulation while aligning the getter signature with the specification.
